h1.a: A Special Message from School Superintendent Linda Reed
Schools Announce Closures to in person learning for remainder of this year

article.div: Governor Polis announced that schools in Colorado would not re-open to in person instruction the remainder of this school year. ASD WILL continue to provide distance learning and expects all students to engage in this process, through the normal end of the school year, on Friday, May 29th.

h1.a: Colorado plans to offer seniors in public schools free SAT tests on a school day next fall

article.div: Colorado public school 12th graders would be able to take the SAT test on a school day next fall for no cost under an agreement the Colorado Department of Education is pursuing with the College Board, the organization that administers the test. This spring’s administration of the SAT along with the rest of the state’s assessment requirements for the 2019-20 school year were suspended by Gov. Jared Polis’ executive order due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

h1.a: New Internet Access Point for Students Installed at the High School

article.div: A new outdoor WiFi access point has been installed at the High school. This access point is to provide outside internet access for students to ensure they can get internet access they need. HUGE thanks to Eric Hittle from local IT Firm, ECHO IT Consulting, and our very own Tommy from ASD's IT department, for their hard work and perseverance in installing this very useful access point.

h1.a: Schools join in to Be The Light for Their Students in Colorado

article.div:
Tonight, and every Friday until we return to our normal activity, the lights of Golden Peaks Stadium will be turned on as a symbol of hope - our hope to see you all again soon. Be strong and be safe as you work from home and know that you are never far from our hearts and minds. We are in this together!
During this time, we ask that you “Be the light” to others. Our challenge is for you to call and reach out to someone (a friend, loved one, family member) each and every day to be the light for them. Please encourage those people to be the light for someone else. TOGETHER, we will continue to shine through this adversity.
Please do not stop by the stadium, but feel free to drive by. Videos and pictures will be posted on social media.

h1.a: The Town of Pagosa Springs and Archuleta County Share Ways to Help During COVID-19

article.div: Thank you for helping the town of Pagosa Springs and Archuleta County in your continued efforts to help reduce the spread of COVID-19.

h1.a: Action shots of our amazing food service team filling sack lunches and breakfasts' for ASD students

article.div:
Admist our recent school closures, ASD’s administration team, food service team and transportation team have developed a plan to continue to be able to provide meals for our students while they move into distance learning from home. We caught Brenda and Leticia 'in action' as they filled sack lunches and breakfast for the kiddos.
HUGE thank you to our food service teams and transportation teams for all of your efforts to ensure that we are able to continue providing meals for our students. #weareASDproud

h1.a: ASD's School Board President, Dr. Greg Schick, is named 2019 McGuffey Award Recipient

article.div: CASB's Executive Director, Cheri Wrench, made a special visit to Pagosa to present the McGuffey Award to ASD's School Board President, Dr. Greg Schick.

h1.a: PFS Principal Jane Parker enthusiastic about school’s direction

article.div: As Pagosa Family School's first principal, Jane Parker loves the idea of building bridges between kids, families, and different educational options.

h1.a: SRO Deputy Martinez on board and ready to work

article.div: As the district's first full-time School Resource Officer (SRO), Deputy James Martinez is a welcomed addition to the ongoing efforts of ASD staff to ensure the safety and security of students, staff, and everyone connected to our schools.
